ver_20120624/Plurk/oauth2/httplib2/test/functional/test_proxies.py

00001 import unittest
00002 import errno
00003 import os
00004 import signal
00005 import subprocess
00006 import tempfile
00007 
00008 import nose
00009 
00010 import httplib2
00011 from httplib2 import socks
00012 from httplib2.test import miniserver
00013 
00014 tinyproxy_cfg = """
00015 User "%(user)s"
00016 Port %(port)s
00017 Listen 127.0.0.1
00018 PidFile "%(pidfile)s"
00019 LogFile "%(logfile)s"
00020 MaxClients 2
00021 StartServers 1
00022 LogLevel Info
00023 """
00024 
00025 
00026 class FunctionalProxyHttpTest(unittest.TestCase):
00027     def setUp(self):
00028         if not socks:
00029             raise nose.SkipTest('socks module unavailable')
00030         if not subprocess:
00031             raise nose.SkipTest('subprocess module unavailable')
00032 
00033         # start a short-lived miniserver so we can get a likely port
00034         # for the proxy
00035         self.httpd, self.proxyport = miniserver.start_server(
00036             miniserver.ThisDirHandler)
00037         self.httpd.shutdown()
00038         self.httpd, self.port = miniserver.start_server(
00039             miniserver.ThisDirHandler)
00040 
00041         self.pidfile = tempfile.mktemp()
00042         self.logfile = tempfile.mktemp()
00043         fd, self.conffile = tempfile.mkstemp()
00044         f = os.fdopen(fd, 'w')
00045         our_cfg = tinyproxy_cfg % {'user': os.getlogin(),
00046                                    'pidfile': self.pidfile,
00047                                    'port': self.proxyport,
00048                                    'logfile': self.logfile}
00049         f.write(our_cfg)
00050         f.close()
00051         try:
00052             # TODO use subprocess.check_call when 2.4 is dropped
00053             ret = subprocess.call(['tinyproxy', '-c', self.conffile])
00054             self.assertEqual(0, ret)
00055         except OSError, e:
00056             if e.errno == errno.ENOENT:
00057                 raise nose.SkipTest('tinyproxy not available')
00058             raise
00059 
00060     def tearDown(self):
00061         self.httpd.shutdown()
00062         try:
00063             pid = int(open(self.pidfile).read())
00064             os.kill(pid, signal.SIGTERM)
00065         except OSError, e:
00066             if e.errno == errno.ESRCH:
00067                 print '\n\n\nTinyProxy Failed to start, log follows:'
00068                 print open(self.logfile).read()
00069                 print 'end tinyproxy log\n\n\n'
00070             raise
00071         map(os.unlink, (self.pidfile,
00072                         self.logfile,
00073                         self.conffile))
00074 
00075     def testSimpleProxy(self):
00076         proxy_info = httplib2.ProxyInfo(socks.PROXY_TYPE_HTTP,
00077                                         'localhost', self.proxyport)
00078         client = httplib2.Http(proxy_info=proxy_info)
00079         src = 'miniserver.py'
00080         response, body = client.request('http://localhost:%d/%s' %
00081                                         (self.port, src))
00082         self.assertEqual(response.status, 200)
00083         self.assertEqual(body, open(os.path.join(miniserver.HERE, src)).read())
00084         lf = open(self.logfile).read()
00085         expect = ('Established connection to host "127.0.0.1" '
00086                   'using file descriptor')
00087         self.assertTrue(expect in lf,
00088                         'tinyproxy did not proxy a request for miniserver')
